page.title: 19HENDRA BARTON,CARDINHAM
page.content: The Linny family live on a farm of 76 acres at{Cardinham.}Both parents are Cornish and have lived on this farm for most of their lives. They practice {mixed farming,}a mixture of livestock and cereal. His livestock consists of 60 sheep, 13 young horses, 6 cows, 26 store bullocks and five calves. Beef does not give him a good return on investment. He also has 15 chickens and 10 ducks. Ten acres are used for corn, and he also grows his own hay -400 bales. Although contented they find farming hard work; most of the time it is a 12 hour day. Given the choice again they would not farm for there are many ties,{little money}to be made and hardly any opportunity for socialising.
